discussion.content:

A & B, as gw is 10.0.1.10

choices.A: This is an expected session created by a session helper.
choices.D: This is an expected session created by an application control profile.
choices.B: Traffic in the original direction (coming from the IP address 10.171.122.38) will be routed to the next-hop IP address 10.0.1.10.
choices.C: Traffic in the original direction (coming from the IP address 10.171.122.38) will be routed to the next-hop IP address 10.200.1.1.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C & D are correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true about FortiManager when it is deployed as a local FDS? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Caches available firmware updates for unmanaged devices.
choices.B: Can be configured as an update server, or a rating server, but not both.
choices.C: Supports rating requests from both managed and unmanaged devices.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding File description (FD) conserve mode?

choices.A: IPS inspection is affected when FortiGate enters FD conserve mode.
choices.D: Restarting the WAD process is required to leave FD conserve mode.
choices.B: A FortiGate enters FD conserve mode when the amount of available description is less than 5%.
choices.C: FD conserve mode affects all daemons running on the device.

discussion.content: Is "File description (FD) conserve mode" a thing? I can't seem to find it anywhere.

choices.B: It has a higher priority than the default route using port1.
choices.D: It is disabled in the FortiGate configuration.
choices.A: It has a lower priority than the default route using port1.
choices.C: It has a higher distance than the default route using port1.

questions.question_text:
Examine the following partial outputs from two routing debug commands; then answer the question below.
# get router info routing-table database
s 0.0.0.0/0 [20/0] via 10.200.2.254, port2, [10/0] s *> 0.0.0.0/0 [10/0] via 10.200.1.254, port1
# get router info routing-table all
s* 0.0.0.0/0 [10/0] via 10.200.1.254, port1
Why the default route using port2 is not displayed in the output of the second command?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

The correct Answer is: D

Because 34000000 is a hex value. In Decimal means 52

Selected Answer: D
The correct Answer is D
Can confirm that answer is D. This exact example even appears in Fortinet's own NSE7 sample questions.
